definition: late-Qing underground resistance movement against the Qing dynasty
elder brother

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
to balance an account/accountancy/accounting
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: It started to fall. In the liberation war, and was cracked down after New China was founded.
sentences.chinese: 解放战争时期哥老会走向没落，新中国成立后被摧毁。

sentences.english: At the beginning of GMT, the government tried to crack down them, and they revolted spontaneously.
sentences.chinese: 民国初年，政府对其进行镇压，哥老会自发反抗。

sentences.english: In the anti-Japanese war, it revolted against the invaders together with the people.
sentences.chinese: 抗日战争时期，哥老会势力与人民一起投身抗日战争。

definition: anti-Qing secret societies
Tiandihui (Chinese fraternal organization)
anti-Qing revolutionary party set up in Changsha by 黃興|黄兴[Huang2 Xing1] in 1904, a precursor of Sun Yat-sen's Alliance for Democracy 同盟會|同盟会[Tong2 meng2 hui4] and of the Guomindang
a secret society
Tongmenghui, Sun Yat-sen's alliance for democracy, founded 1905, became the Guomindang 國民黨|国民党 in 1912
anti-Qing/refers to the revolutionary movements in late 19th and early 20th century leading up to 1911 Xinhai Revolution 辛亥革命[Xin1 hai4 Ge2 ming4]
White Lotus society
Great Sword Society, an offshoot of the White Lotus in the late Qing dynasty, involved in anti-Western activity at the time of the Boxer rebellion
anti-Qing revolutionary party set up in 1904 under Cai Yuanpei 蔡元培/same as 復古會|复古会
traditional secret society, Chinese equivalent of Freemasons
triad, Chinese crime gang/triad society, anti-Manchu secret society in Qing-dynasty China
see 天地會|天地会[Tian1 di4 hui4]
Dagger Society, anti-Qing secret society who mounted an unsuccessful rebellion in 1855
military clique/junta/warlord
uprising/insurrection/revolt
Tenrikyo (Japanese religion)
